737 Max Kerap Kecelakaan, CEO Boeing Ajukan 'Potong Gaji'
06 Nov 2019, 05:52 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


CEO Boeing Dennis Muilenburg, (Jim WATSON / AFP)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Chairman Boeing yang baru, Dave Calhoun, mengatakan pejabat CEO perusahaan, Dennis Muilenburg, tidak akan mendapatkan sebagian besar pendapatannya pada 2019 dan 2020. Alasan pemangkasan itu karena banyaknya kritik kepada perusahaan setelah dua kecelakaan fatal pada pesawat 737 Max yang merenggut nyawa 346 orang.CNN memberitakan pada Selasa (5/11), Calhoun menjelaskan pada sesi wawancara dengan CNBC, dia dipanggil Muilenburg pada akhir pekan lalu dan mengajukan dirinya tidak mendapatkan bonus dan keuntungan saham dari perusahaan pada tahun ini. Calhoun ditunjuk menjadi chairman pada bulan lalu, jabatan itu sebelumnya diduduki Muilenburg.Boeing 737 Max telah dilarang terbang sejak Maret dan hal itu telah merugikan perusahaan hingga miliaran dolar Amerika Serikat. Kini Boeing juga bersiap membayar ganti rugi senilai US$5 miliar kepada konsumen dan juga kompensasi buat keluarga korban.Keuntungan saham dan bonus merupakan sebagian besar pendapatan Muilenburg. Pada 2018 dia diberikan US$23,4 juta dari perusahaan, sebesar US$20,4 juta merupakan keuntungan saham dan bonus.Calhoun mengatakan dewan direksi Boeing percaya Muilenburg telah melakukan segala hal saat krisis. Menurut dia Muilenburg merupakan orang yang tepat memimpin perusahaan."Dia telah mengatur kami kembali melayani," kata Calhoun.Pada pekan lalu Muilenburg menghadapi pertanyaan keras dari anggota DPR dan Senat AS selama dua hari, termasuk soal pengunduran dirinya atau merelakan pendapatannya. Saat itu dia juga mengakui Boeing melakukan kesalahan desain pada 737 Max.Pada akhir Oktober lalu Komite Nasional Keselamatan Transportasi (KNKT) telah menjelaskan insiden naas 737 Max 8 dengan nomor penerbangan Lion Air JT 610. Insiden yang terjadi di perairan Tanjung Karawang, Jawa Barat pada 29 Oktober 2018 itu menewaskan 189 penumpang serta awak kapal.KNKT menyimpulkan pilot kesulitan merespons fitur baru Maneuvering Characteristics Augmentation System (MCAS). Kondisi ini dipersulit ketiadaan petunjuk dalam buku panduan maupun pelatihan. (fea)

737 Max Often Accident, Boeing CEO Filed 'Cut Salary'
Nov 6 2019, 05:52 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Boeing CEO Dennis Muilenburg, (Jim WATSON / AFP)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - The new Boeing Chairman, Dave Calhoun, said the company's chief executive officer, Dennis Muilenburg, would not get most of his revenue in 2019 and 2020. The reason for the cut was due to the many criticisms of the company after two fatal accidents on the 737 Max that claimed the lives of 346 people. CNN reported on Tuesday (5/11), Calhoun explained in an interview session with CNBC, he was called Muilenburg at the end of last week and proposed that he did not get a bonus and profit from the company this year. Calhoun was appointed chairman last month, a post previously held by Muilenburg. Boeing 737 Max has been banned from flying since March and has cost the company billions of US dollars. Now Boeing is also preparing to pay compensation of US $ 5 billion to consumers and also compensation for the victims' families. The profits of shares and bonuses represent a large portion of Muilenburg's income. In 2018 he was given US $ 23.4 million from the company, amounting to US $ 20.4 million in share profits and bonuses. Calhoun said the Boeing board of directors believed Muilenburg had done everything during the crisis. According to him Muilenburg was the right person to lead the company. "He has arranged us to return to service," Calhoun said. Last week Muilenburg faced strong questions from members of the House and Senate for two days, including the matter of resigning or giving up his income. At that time he also admitted that Boeing made a design error on the 737 Max. At the end of last October the National Transportation Safety Committee (KNKT) had explained the unfortunate incident of the 737 Max 8 with the Lion Air flight number JT 610. The incident that occurred in the waters of Tanjung Karawang, West Java on October 29, 2018 that killed 189 passengers and crew. The HCV concluded that pilots had difficulty responding to the new Maneuvering Characteristics Augmentation System (MCAS) feature. This condition is complicated by the absence of instructions in the guidebook or training. (fea)
